intro: Spiloxene scullyi, commonly known as the Scully's spiloxene, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species from further decline.
